Pre-Game Insights: England will be without their regular ODI captain, Jos Buttler, who has been sidelined with a calf injury since the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 in June.
Taking on the leadership role, Liam Livingstone will captain the team in Buttler’s absence, marking a significant opportunity for him to lead the English squad.
West Indies, led by Shai Hope, are aiming for a bounce-back performance after their 2-1 ODI and T20I series defeats in Sri Lanka.
Cricket West Indies has made a single change to their ODI squad, bringing in left-handed batter Shimron Hetmyer in place of Alick Athanaze.
Both teams will aim to fine-tune their lineups and address gaps, making this series a critical opportunity to assess form and build momentum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England’s tour of the West Indies in 2024 is set to deliver a packed schedule, featuring three ODIs followed by five T20Is.
The tour kicks off with the ODI series on October 31, setting the stage for intense competition between the two teams.
Following the ODIs, the T20I series will commence, culminating on November 17.
